toys

Class Toy

  • java.lang.Object
    • toys.Toy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeachBall, MockToy, Rock, SoftToy, SqueakyToy, ToyMouse, Yarn

    public abstract class Toy
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the in-game toys

        Parameters:
        toyPrice - The price of the toy.
        toyType - The type of the toy.
        toyHappinessIncrease - The amount a toy increases a pet's happiness.
        toyDurability - The durability of the toy.
        toyExertion - The amount a toy increases a pet's hunger and tiredness.

        Getter for Toy.exertion

        How much the toy increases the pets tiredness and hunger upon being played with as an int.

      • isBroken

        public boolean isBroken()
        Returns whether the toy is broken or not
        Returns:
        a boolean representing the state of the toy, true if broken else false.

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity()
        Returns the quantity of the toy in the player's inventory/toyList.
        Returns:
        the quanity of the toy in the player's toyList as an int.

      • setDurability

        public void setDurability(int durability)
        Setter for the durability attribute. Used by the Toy subclasses to reset their durabilities
        Parameters:
        durability - The value for the durability to be set to.

      • changeQuantity

        public boolean changeQuantity(int change)
        Increase the quantity of the food by 'change' if the change is non-zero and if quantity is greater than one. Return a boolean to indicate whether the change was successful.
        Parameters:
        change - The amount quantity is changed by.
        Returns:
        true if the change was successful, false otherwise.

      • resetDurability

        public abstract void resetDurability()
        Reset the durability of the toy to the initial value for each type of toy.

      • resetBroken

        public void resetBroken()
        Reset broken to false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides the toString() method of java.lang.object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string showing the food type and its quantity.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two toys based on their type attribute. Used for determining if a toy is a favourite or least favourite toy.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the toy's types are equal, false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Updates the hashCode for the type attribute in line with it being overriden above. hashCode must be overriden when java.lang.equals is overridden.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hashCode of the type attribute as an int.

      • use

        public void use(int petRoughness)
        Use the toy and damage it according to the pet's roughness. If the durability drops to 0, return true so that the toy can be removed from the player's inventory and the happiness of the pet can be adjusted accordingly. Else returns false indicating that the toy is sill intact.
        Parameters:
        petRoughness - The roughness of the pet with toys.
